yep

The boards censorship is a bit inconvenient here , but for anyone wondering the _"%%%"_ word is a 3 letter abbreviation of a derogatory term for homosexuals. 

You were likely punished so harshly primarily for saying "%%%" since Riot has a [zero tolerance policy for hate speech](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/oii1yyRe-pretty-pathetic-how-riot-so-so-desperate-for-new-players-that-they-allow-premades-free-will?comment=0005).

I have noticed though, that it seems like you were quoting another player the first time, and then you made another reference to it the second time? Assuming you have not been chat restricted before this, you might want to take a shot in the dark and [ask Riot](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to maybe reduce your punishment on this basis, but don't count on it. 

Keep in mind that not only is that term just unacceptable to use at all (even in reference), but you have also said _"rest of you can choke on a fat one"_ and _"people like you are shit"_ (among other things) which are not  acceptable behaviour either. However, I am not Riot so I don't want to rule anything out.

Also, I may be wrong but it seems like you stopped trying to win for a bit saying _"fun loss, enjoyt"_ and then came back with _"ill help but only for yasuo"_. If that is the case then there's pretty much no chance of getting this punishment reduced, since attempting to [purposefully loose the game](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player#h1q3) is a pretty serious offence.


____*

Just as a bit of advice BTW, I strongly recommend you be very careful now because **your next offense will result in a PERMANENT BAN**. The system isn't very forgiving at higher tiers so even something small could result in a ban.

If I was you I would either, _/mute all_ at the start of every game, unbind the enter key so you can't type in chat, or drag the chat to the side of the screen so it is no longer visible. Also if you need a hand with reforming, feel free to get in touch with me. Either here or on discord (Tele#0343)

Good luck, and be careful!

Well said!

I don't really have a point to make here, just curious about the interesting implications that this gives rise to.

That word is also an everyday non offensive slang word for a cigarette, especially in the UK.
Whats to stop brittish players from being banned when they say _"Brb, gunna step out for a F%%."_ or _"Sorry back now, was having a F%% in load screen."_


Surely its unfair _(perhaps even mildly unethical)_ to have different ban rules in different servers. Yet inevitably that word must get used a lot more in the european server, and not in a detrimental way.

Is it fair to impose American _(who often seem to be more sensitive and reactionary than other nations)_ values onto the wider landscape of the game.

For example, 'Chav' is pretty offensive thing to call someone in the UK, but i'd be willing to bet that isn't on the system's list of 'instant ban' words, because it isn't used at 
all in the states.

Much like calling someone an 'Egg' in south Auckland, will get you trip to the hospital, where the N word _(which is hyper offencive in the states)_ might just get you a laugh 
or a sideways look.

But you cant exactly ban the word Egg from league just becasue it's offensive to a small group of people.

Taking that logic then, that you cant ban an ordinary word because it has offensive connotations to one demographic, is it fair to ban F%% when it is just an ordinary term for a large section of the population, just because one nation doesn't agree with it, but not ban other words like Chav, that other nations don't like?

It's an American game for sure _(or is it? Seeming Tencent owns it.)_, but NA does not make up the majority of players, why are their values and morals more important than OCE words like Abo or Egg, or British words like Chav or Pikey?

_____________

Like I said, I have no point to make here, just posing an interesting observation that could be some food for thought.
